description: Weekly <Oct. 9-30, 1922> Began with volume 2, number 8 (October 19, 1918). Ceased in 1922? Last issue located: Vol. 5, no. 8 [i.e. 9] (Oct. 30, 1922). Place of publication varies: Great Falls, Oct. 19, 1918-May 7, 1921; Billings, June 10-<Oct. 30>, 1922. Suspended: Nov. 16-23, 1918; June 1921-May 1922. Official organ of: National Nonpartisan League in the State of Montana. Description based on: Volume 2, number 8 (October 19, 1918); title from masthead (Chroniclingamerica.loc.gov, viewed May 7, 2014). Latest issue consulted: Volume 3, number 51 (December 20, 1919) (Chroniclingamerica.loc.gov, viewed May 7, 2014).

description: Weekly Began with vol. I, no. 2 (June 1, 1882); ceased with vol. III, no. 49 (May 2, 1885). "Democratic." Cf. An Illustrated history of the Yellowstone Valley. Publisher varies: Devine & McFarlin, <May 2, 1885>. First issue misnumbered no. 2. Cf. An Illustrated history of the Yellowstone Valley. Merged with: Billings rustler, and: Post (Billings, Mont.), to form: Daily gazette (Billings, Mont.), and: Montana stock gazette. Description based on: Vol. 1, no. 2 (June 1, 1882); title from masthead (Chroniclingamerica.loc.gov, viewed January 13, 2016). Latest issue consulted: Vol. III, no. 49 (May 2, 1885) (Chroniclingamerica.loc.gov, viewed January 13, 2016). Billings rustler Post (Billings, Mont.) Daily gazette (Billings, Mont.)
